lexUnit.name: muzzle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the projecting part of the face, including the nose and mouth, of an animal such as a dog or horse

sentence.text: One of Danny 's birthday presents had been a puppy -- a rough-haired mongrel with a dash of Airedale , the shaggy muzzle of an Irish terrier and paws like a wolfhound .
He rubbed the muzzle of a horse when it nosed up to him , and scratched its ears .
A ragged legion passed by her as she huddled in a thicket of thorn and holly , her hand gently covering the muzzle of her horse .
` Why , here 's Mr Honeysett 's old Bess , " she said , bending down to stroke the dog 's muzzle .
This face of anxiety refined and narrowed the horse 's muzzle , and so made it more attractive for a photograph !
Nanny walked to the front of the handsome grey gelding and the child put out a small hand to rub his silk-soft muzzle .
While fitzAlan hefted the grey 's hoof and set to work , she glanced about , absently patting Chalon 's velvety muzzle .
The bear roared at him with fury , its black muzzle and huge jaws covered in a thick white froth .
The foal cringes , lowering its shoulders , extending its neck , and raising its muzzle up to the other horse .
He pushed his muzzle into her lap , wagging his rump , pleading to be let out .
He would swing his muzzle at a fly
The bear scarcely repaid the compliment but sat on his hindquarters , hungrily stuffing his great muzzle from a pile of scraps thrown around him .
I 'm thinking of polled cattle or dogs with very , very short muzzles or dwarf legs and so on .
With regard to your pony , if she has creamy/mealy muzzle and eyes and light in colour on an otherwise dark coat , she is definitely an Exmoor .
The Gloucester has a slate-coloured muzzle and black tongue and teats .
